dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: So, I'm reading this, right? And it says, "10, 20 or 30 professions which vanish within a decade." I mean, what?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So, I'm reading this, right? And it says, ten, twenty or thirty professions which vanish within a decade. I mean, what?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: When they hear about 10, 20 or 30 professions which vanish within a decade, it is very natural to ask a simple question: How can they best prepare for their future career in such a rapidly changing and unpredictable world?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, it's pretty wild, but, uh, the article has some good points on how to actually, you know, prepare for that.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, it's pretty wild, but, uh, the article has some good points on how to actually, you know, prepare for that.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: 'Prepare'? Like, by, um, learning project management? Seriously? That's their big solution?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: 'Prepare'? Like, by, um, learning project management? Seriously? That's their big solution?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Well, here are five things Id recommend to all students interested in future-proofing their career. ... 1. Project management skills are transferable across many fields

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: It's not just project management, but it's a huge transferable skill. Every job description asks for it now, Host_A. It's practical.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: It's not just project management, but it's a huge transferable skill. Every job description asks for it now, Host_A. It's practical.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Indeed you will find almost every job description calls for project management skills or project management experience, as more and more companies and organizations build their work and activities around specific projects.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Practical? It's like, corporate buzzword bingo. "Expect the best, plan for the worst"? That's from like, the 80s.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Practical? It's like, corporate buzzword bingo. Expect the best, plan for the worst? That's from like, the 80s.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: An unofficial motto of project managers is wisely expressed by American entrepreneur Denis Waitley: Expect the best, plan for the worst, and prepare to be surprised.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Okay, but the sentiment is still true! And, uh, what about multitasking? They say it's unavoidable.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Okay, but the sentiment is still true! And, uh, what about multitasking? They say it's unavoidable.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The reality is that in the modern complex world multitasking is unavoidable and multitasking skills are highly valued.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Multitasking? Are you kidding? The article itself admits it's a "vexed question" that leads to "rapid exhaustion"!
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Multitasking? Are you kidding? The article itself admits it's a vexed question that leads to rapid exhaustion!
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Others argue that multitasking actually is as Latin say vexata quaestio (vexed question) as it may negatively affect your productivity outputs and even lead rapid exhaustion and health destruction.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: But it also says it's highly valued and unavoidable! The key is effective multitasking. There's a whole school of thought on it.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: But it also says it's highly valued and unavoidable! The key is effective multitasking. There's a whole school of thought on it.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The reality is that in the modern complex world multitasking is unavoidable and multitasking skills are highly valued. ... as effective planning and prioritizing are in the center of the modern school of multitasking.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: No, the "school of thought" is it's a productivity killer! And "strong communication skills"? Wow, groundbreaking advice.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: No, the school of thought is it's a productivity killer! And strong communication skills? Wow, groundbreaking advice.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: 3. Dont forget about strong communication skills

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: It's not about just having them. It's modern effective communication, with rules. Like, the iPhone prototypes failed until they communicated better.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: It's not about just having them. It's modern effective communication, with rules. Like, the iPhone prototypes failed until they communicated better.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: in fact, the first 50 prototypes of the iPhone failed and kept failing until the innovative team learned to communicate between each other better.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: That's a massive stretch. And "advanced digital skills"? So, uh, use Microsoft Office better? That's saving us from vanishing jobs?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: That's a massive stretch. And advanced digital skills? So, uh, use Microsoft Office better? That's saving us from vanishing jobs?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: 4. Advanced digital skills have become key ... Employers demand recent graduates be capable of everything from using the internet efficiently to producing virtuoso work on Microsoft Office, and from software coding to advance internet business skills.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: No, it's coding, advanced internet business skills! Basic computer knowledge isn't enough, obviously.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: No, it's coding, advanced internet business skills! Basic computer knowledge isn't enough, obviously.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: In this environment, having basic computer knowledge is not enough. Employers demand recent graduates be capable of everything from using the internet efficiently to producing virtuoso work on Microsoft Office, and from software coding to advance internet business skills.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: This just sounds like a list of things people already know! It doesn't address jobs just disappearing!
dialogue_turns.tts_text: This just sounds like a list of things people already know! It doesn't address jobs just disappearing!

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: It is addressing it! By making you more adaptable! And honestly, emotional intelligence? That's the one thing tech can't replace.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: It is addressing it! By making you more adaptable! And honestly, emotional intelligence? That's the one thing tech can't replace.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: 5. Emotional intelligence cant be easily replaced by technology

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Emotional intelligence? So, like, being nice? That's what's gonna keep me employed when robots take over? Uh, I just don't buy it.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Emotional intelligence? So, like, being nice? That's what's gonna keep me employed when robots take over? Uh, I just don't buy it.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: It's not 'being nice,' it's about dealing with emotions, creating a positive environment. It's crucial for teams, for leadership, for interviews! It's personal resilience!
dialogue_turns.tts_text: It's not 'being nice,' it's about dealing with emotions, creating a positive environment. It's crucial for teams, for leadership, for interviews! It's personal resilience!
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: In a nutshell, emotional intelligence is your ability to deal effectively with emotions, create appropriate emotional relations with each other, communicate competently with workplace teams, and intelligently and appropriately use emotional information to create a positive workplace environment. By developing and training these skills and abilities, you can be more successful in your personal interactions, from attending job interviews to creating a positive emotional environment for a team youre leading...

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Resilience? More like whistling past the graveyard, if you ask me.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Resilience? More like whistling past the graveyard, if you ask me.
